alert.note: Alert for Lee; Ogle; Winnebago (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 7:17PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR OGLE...LEE AND WINNEBAGO COUNTIES... At 717 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Durand to near Sublette, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Beloit, South Beloit and Rockton. This includes... Castle Rock State Park, Lee County Fairgrounds, Lowden State Park, Ogle County Fairgrounds, Rock Cut State Park, Rock Valley College, Rockford Rivets Baseball, Rockford Speedway, White Pines State Park, and Winnebago County Fairgrounds. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 78 and 123. I-88 between mile markers 51 and 82. I-90 between mile markers 0 and 18. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central Illinois. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
